name: Banking Bonanza
title: Most Commercial Bank Branches Per Capita
description: In 2023, San Marino boasted 122 commercial bank branches per 100,000 adults, the highest in the world, highlighting its robust banking infrastructure.

name: Spending Surge
title: Rapid Growth in Household Consumption
description: In 2022, household consumption expenditure in San Marino grew by 15.56%, with per capita growth reaching 17.26%, indicating a strong consumer market.

name: Health Priority
title: High Government Spending on Health
description: In 2022, 29.51% of San Marino's general government expenditure was dedicated to health, showcasing a commitment to public health services.

name: Longevity Leaders
title: High Male Survival Rate to Age 65
description: In 2022, 93.95% of males in San Marino survived to age 65, reflecting excellent healthcare and living conditions.

name: Mature Male Majority
title: Significant Male Population in Their 50s
description: In 2023, males aged 50-54 and 55-59 made up 8.91% and 9.08% of the male population, respectively, indicating a mature demographic.

name: Tiny but Mighty
title: Minimal Agricultural Contribution
description: In 2022, agriculture, forestry, and fishing contributed only 0.01% to San Marino's GDP, highlighting its minimal reliance on these sectors.

name: Classroom Comfort
title: Low Pupil-Teacher Ratios
description: In 2018, San Marino boasted a pupil-teacher ratio of 6.93 in primary and 5.84 in secondary education, ensuring personalized attention for students.

name: Room for Improvement
title: Few Trained Female Teachers
description: As of 2023, only 2.84% of female teachers in secondary education were trained, indicating a need for enhanced teacher training programs.

name: Safe Beginnings
title: Low Infant and Child Mortality Rates
description: In 2023, San Marino recorded an infant mortality rate of 1.4 per 1,000 live births, reflecting its strong healthcare system for young children.

name: Urban Dwellers
title: Minimal Rural Population
description: In 2023, only 733 people resided in rural areas of San Marino, emphasizing its urban-centric population distribution.
